title: MOOC Integrating Computational Thinking and Robotics in Early Childhood Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with digital tools and foundational knowledge of early childhood education
context.additional_context: Microlearning implementation via smartphones for corporate education managers/leaders, with a goal of acquiring practical strategies to integrate computational thinking and robotics into early childhood education.

learning_goals: Application of the four core elements of computational thinking (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithms) to early childhood education activities via MOOC platforms
Robotics practice scenarios for young children can be designed using smartphone-accessible robot programming tools (such as block coding).
Interaction strategies between learner-instructor, learner-content, and learner-learner can be applied to MOOC environments to enhance educational effectiveness.

resources: Robotics Educational Materials for Early Childhood (Linked Video Resources)
Mobile Quiz/Discussion Tools for Interaction Facilitation
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
